name: Di Bruno Bros.

attributes.Ambience: {'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}
attributes.GoodForMeal: {'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}

categories: Sandwiches, Cheese Shops, Meat Shops, Italian, Specialty Food, Restaurants, Food

text:
I frequent di Bruno bros since I live close by. The selection is incredible! I swear they have 100 different cheeses. The staff is very friendly and helpful. 

Things I love there:
Oat milk latte
Breakfast sandwiches (have interesting delicious cheeses in them) 
Selection of oils and vinegars
All the sweets (warning the cake is VERY dense.... Don't eat too much or you'll feel a sugar coma coming on)
All the cheeses
Prepared foods
Cheesy potatoes 
Creamed spinach 
The staff! 

Things that weren't as good as I thought they'd be (but not worth taking off stars):
The cake (see above - just a bit too sweet - yes even for cake)
Eggplant parmigiana - not bad but not as good as everything else 

I hope this helps! I'm so lucky to live close by.

I ordered in plenty of time for Christmas delivery.  A tracking number was given but the package never left DiBruno's.  I have tried to contact by phone several times, left voicemails as no one answered.  Never heard back. I signed an online contact form and haven't heard back.  I emailed and haven't heard back.  This is beyond poor customer service not to contact the customer.  I sent this package, $137 order,  to one of my clients. I am so thankful that I did not send it to all my clients as I contemplated doing.  What a disaster that would have been.  Very disappointed and at this point truly frustrated.

HORRIBLE customer service! I have ordered from here before and its clear to see they dont give a damn about their customers!! After you leave messages etc no return calls or emails! Funny how all during December they are out of alot of stuff but SHOCKER a couple of days after Christmas the stuff is back in stock. They have shown they are unreliable and unprofessional and do not care about their customers. Until they wake up I will order from a company who cares!

Come here if you love cheese. 

Pros:
- They were sticklers about wearing masks, an older lady walked in without a mask and was immediately asked to put one on. 
- They offered samplers of pretty much everything, they ask you to quickly slip the piece under your mask.
- Huge assortment of cheese and dried meats
- Friendly staff, listened to our preferences of what cheese we liked and recommended a few to try that were similar 

Cons:
- easy to spend money, we bought everything we tasted lol
- smaller space, can't imagine foot traffic during peak times and people trying out samplers right bumping into you. Overheard a lady said she wanted to step outside since she didn't feel safe during covid, which I completely get

Horrible customer service. They are quick to take your money, but not solve any problems. they billed me for items that i did not receive and no one will email me back from customer service. i do not know how they stay open.

Placed an order for a Christmas gift on Black Friday. Was asked to  choose delivery week at check out. Chose Christmas week. Was notified via generic email the night before it was to be shipped (5 days before Christmas) that "supply chain issues were affecting some of their orders but they were working day and night to satisfy customers."
Since then I've emailed and called several
times to ask when my order will be shipped as I am
traveling after the holidays. If the order ships while I'm gone the enclosed food will spoil before I return. I was trying to inform them  to postpone delivery until after I return.  I've received no response or acknowledgement. Christmas is tomorrow and my order is still "awaiting fulfillment". And other than the generic email that my order "may be delayed" I've received no correspondence from this company regarding the order I placed a month ago. This will be the last time I order from them.

I went to the 9th street store on the corner of Samson and was so happy. Always love their sandwiches and service but Wes went out of his way to get me some extra cranberry sauce when I asked it for it. It made my day! Thank you!

Now that this is in my neck of the woods, it's both a blessing and a curse. A blessing in that if I'm craving a nice block of goat cheese, I've got a place. A curse in that it takes everything in my power to not visit here every single day. It's a beacon of all things charcuterie and I'm hooked. It's a tiny Italian Market establishment, but stocked to the brim with aged cheeses, dried & cured meats, jars of sweet jams and spicy olives, vodka sauce & arrabiata, and a good variety of crackers and breads (if you get there early enough). All that's missing is wine, but just go half a block down to DiBrunos bottle shop and you're set. 

Word on the street is they host wine and cheese parties. You can rent out the place for the night and impress your friends and coworkers by nibbling on a chunk of Gouda and saying "yes, this is cheese." 

Pro tip: they sometimes leave unsold baguettes outside the door in a bag but sidewalk food is sus at best (although I was tempted.)
Horrible customer service - very difficult people to work with and refused to help make one adjustment to an incorrect address

Absolutely the best food I have eaten .   Mac and cheese to die for.  I didn't know DiBrunos was in the area so I ordered food online and it is delicious.
Will be ordering frequently .

Di Bruno has all types of cheeses and meats! We were overwhelmed by all they had but their staff were super helpful with questions and suggestions. We got a variety of things from a brie to goat cheeses and sampled a shmear which was very tasty. We picked up several sopressata and prosciutto and jams. We enjoyed everything we got and was not disappointed.

I stop by here impulsively while walking arround the area. Let me first say that this sort of shop isn't a place I would typically go. The products all look amazing but they are a little above my typical grocery budget. As a result even though the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, I was hesitant to engage too much. Ultimately I bought a few "orphan" cheeses and some bread. The bread was AMAZING and I can't recommend it highly enough. The cheese was fine by my selection didn't really go together that well. Had I been more willing to seek the help of the staff I'm sure I would have wound up with a more pleasing combination.

While shopping I stopped by a few of the other similar stores selling cheese/meat/dry good. This was by FAR the friendliest.

They have the type of products that you can honestly only find in Italy. Let me tell you I go grocery shopping in all the Italian grocery shops so I know it's hard to find the higher end in quality product from Italy. All tour stores have the usual San Daniel prosciutto and nothing else, but only Di Bruno has an actual selection. 10/10 definitely recommend. Grab some food from there to eat for a special date and you won't regret it.

Amazing 

Selection? 
Quality?     
Prices?       

The challenge is to choose and we selected some incredible cheeses to go with our meal

We bought some jar sauce as well and will be back for sure

Just want to say thank you~ My son LOVES his first eat like a cheesemonger monthly delivery. I VERY much appreciate you making it vegetarian as requested and will be posting this review. 

Thanks again from a repeat buyer!!!!!

Sitting out side along 9th street on a perfectly beautiful night with my wife. This is what life is about. Fine meats and cheeses under romantic lighting. 

If you were looking for a first date this would be the perfect place before November.

Laughable bad place for cheese.  

The first thing any person with the slightest bit of cheese knowledge knows will be the entire staff is clueless when it comes to cheese.  From storing it, to cutting it, to temperature control, etc.  Showing photos of the place to other store owners in different parts of the world their first reaction is total shock and they visible cringe seeing pics of unrefrigerated cheese.  These are people who grew up making cheese and working in cheese.

On the bright side, the staff is always incredibly friendly and many non cheese related products are stocked (though a touch pricey).

Does di Bruno Brothers have new management?  I've been shopping there for 15 years but have been surprised at how many things they've always carried are now missing.  The customer-friendly attitude I've always appreciated has also changed; when I asked about the shortages, I was told, essentially, "it's hard to keep a store stocked; if you think it's easy, try it yourself. ". At the very least, they should take down their sign saying "We welcome all feedback," as they clearly do not.
This place is amazing. Went to Phil I for a mini vacation and I'm we loved this place. Ppl were so helpful and knowledgeable. Grab the mole sausage. It's so fn a ma zn

Such a great atmosphere and selection of meats and cheese. We learned the history of the market and thr tradition that continues. We came to the market 2 times during out stay a must if your in the area.

There staff is helpful, friendly, knowledgeable and they make you feel like one of the family. 

Will stop in everytime we visit philly.

My friend booked the After Hours event at the original DBB location in the Italian Market for his wife's birthday last week, and i (luckily) was invited. I have to say, it was one of the coolest things I've done in the city. The staff people (Scotty & Jeffrey Davey or Davey Jeff? Can't remember which one! lol) were AMAZING! So helpful, nice, friendly, knowledgeable - just all around great! 

The food was obviously amazing too! Specially curated platters, pairings, and so much awesomeness! Loved every minute of it! Thank you!

Recently attended an After Hours event at the original DBB location in the Italian Market. It was an unbelievably incredible setup and the quality and knowledge of the products and sourcing is unparalleled. If I could eat here every day I would.
Coming down to the Italian market is like stepping back in time with appreciation for current good food. The staff couldn't be nicer and there are so many goodies in this small space.

I used this location of Di Bruno Brothers for a party I was having for my husband's 40th Birthday. I wanted 5 very specific cheese boards and accompanying condiments, bread, crackers and olives. I also wanted to pair the cheeses with cocktails for the party. I had the pleasure of working with Tommy Amorim, he was knowledgeable and helpful with every aspect of this process. He helped me choose a beautiful selection of cheeses with really great jams, mostardas, honey, marmalade's and additional accompaniments. They cheese boards ended up looking so great, tasted even better and they were a huge hit at the party. I cannot thank Tommy and Di Bruno brothers enough for everything they did to help us out, please don't hesitate to use them for you next even if party either!

Fabulous! 
Cheeses I had never heard of before nor tasted... wonderful meats. Staff is generous with the tastings and very knowledgeable.
Great experience even tho it did cost us over $100 by the time we got out of there!! lol

Those Di Bruno Bros are alright!

Winding down our time at the Italian market, we decided to stop in and get some snacks for dinner, but it looked like the rest of Philly had the same idea based on the crowd inside!

Di Bruno Bros staff are top notch, not only explaining everything you could imagine with the thing you're pointing at behind the counter, but also in giving you great pairing advice if you want one thing to go with another.

We got the following things:

Blue cheese
Parmesan Cheese
liver pate
Prosciutto 

Man this was some good stuff!  Cheese is excellent, coming from "the house of cheese".  The blue cheese was both creamy and had these little crunchy ends to it which made me smile every time I took a bite.  The Parmesan was also fresh and really popped with flavor.

As for the meats, i'd never tried pate before Di Bruno Bros, but how delicious!  The prosciutto wrapping the blue cheese was some of the best things we'd eaten in Philly.  

Everything we sampled was fresh, and even if you weren't sure about a cheese or a cured meat, they'd happily slice a little off for you to try, and try we did.  I really didn't taste anything I didn't like.  The problem, it seems, was making a selection!

I didn't know what I was expecting when I walked in, but if I lived in the area, i'd be at Di Bruno Bros several times a month for snacks.  If you're in the Italian market, or even if you're not (they have a website), check these Bros out!

This is what cheese heaven must be. The second you walk in your senses kick in. First you see all of these wonderful displays of cheeses from all parts of the world. Next you get this amazing smell of all these different cheeses, olives and cured meats. Finally you get to sample the different varieties of cheeses they have. By the time you leave there you will have purchased at least 3-4 different types of cheeses and meats. The store is a bit on the small side but just get in line and it will soon be your turn to taste and be served by one of their experienced staff. The person who took care of ya was friendly and knowledgeable. Once we sampled several of the cheeses he started to suggest others which were similar to what we liked. It took us a while but all throughout he was patient and helpful. By the time we left I had not realized how much we had purchased but when the bill was presented I was surprised it was not more. If you visit the Italian Market you have to stop here; well worth the wait.

Wow! We stumbled into this little gem when wandering the Italian Market. The smell of the cheeses were amazing when we entered the store! We were greeted with samples and smiles. They really helped us figure out what we wanted to get and what paired well together. We ended up leaving with spanish olives (so yummy and buttery), manchego (also very buttery), a fresh french baguette, other large green olives, and a meat that was recommended! I cannot wait to return!

As soon as I walked in, I knew I was in cheese heaven! They have an array of choices for cheeses, meats, breads, sauces, olives, oils, and basically anything else you need for a cheese board/picnic. My favorite cheese was this manchego that was so buttery, I'm still thinking about it!  
Plus the service was great, the man that helped us allowed us to sample a few pieces before deciding what we wanted, amazing right?! When I'm back in Philly, def coming back here!

Love Di Bruno Bros! I wanted to make an amateur cheese platter for NYE so we headed to the Italian Market. It was packed on NYE of course, but service was fast. The employees were not shy with samples and answered all our questions. We got cheese,meat, crackers, spreads, olives, tomatoes! Delicious!!!

This place is amazing all there products bring me back to a time of Quality and old-school traditions Every time I walk in to their store I go to buy two or three things I always buy a lot more I always find that thing I remember when I was a kid or just excellent lunch meat, cheeses or whatever product they cary. They personify Quality and old-school food to me. 
 On a recent visit before Christmas I had a slight problem with my order when I called just to let them know the customer service went above a beyond anything I could of expected. This is the mark of a truly great business. Thanks for always making my Holliday's that much more special you don't know what it means it's not just the food but the memories of the loved ones long gone and times past YOU bring it back with a context and definition I can't put in to words.

Both Christmas gifts that we ordered were shipped to two different family members out of state were NOT the items I purchased. When I reached out to Maria Crespo, I was asked for "proof" of wrong items and wanted the recipient(s) to send detailed pictures of the gift they received. This is NOT how mistakes should be handled. I am NOT asking my family to take pictures of their GIFTS and I will NEVER order from you again.  Buyer beware and your customer service sucks.

Came here for a 30th birthday after hours and had such a great time with a few friends. I never been here during the day but I highly suggest making a booking after hours and you can try ANYTHING you want in the store for approximately 2 hours (except the raw foods - like bacon.. if only they could cook it!). It comes with a price but its SO worth it and so much fun! You can be fancy schmancy and bring your own wine/beer too :)

The staff is incredibly knowledgeable about all their items. Ask them anything and they will be able to answer it all. Staff is very energetic and have great energy. We all had a blast and learned so much about cheeses. The meats and cheeses here are expensive but it's because it's so good. There wasn't one thing that I tried during my visit that I didn't like. Highly recommend!
Amazing selection of cheese and sausage. 10 kinda of prosciutto (3 domestic). Knowledgeable staff.

We spent a nice Friday afternoon in Di Bruno Brothers.  I loved being there when it isn't crowded.  The employees were extremely nice allowing me and my daughter to sample various cheeses and meats.  A nice way to try cheese that you might otherwise never get to eat.  We visit this cheese shop every time we are in South Philly.  Nice hometown experience with very knowledgeable staff.

As a philly native I have been shopping DiBruno Bros 9th st location for 30 years. They have always been helpful and offer samples of various cheeses based on your tastes. They have also recommended good values of types of cheeses. My experience today was very disappointing. The employee had a nasty attitude and appeared to be annoyed by my questions. I asked for a couple of cheese styles I was looking for and he cut samples. I guess I should have asked for prices this time since he sold me the most expensive cheese I have ever purchased anywhere in my life. Do your employees now work on commission?

We were very disappointed after driving up from Washington DC to shop in Little Italy. We filled our basket with various types of pastas and cheeses such as fresh mozzarella.  We wanted a specific cheese that we saw hanging up. The clerk took down the cheese removed the wrapper and apparently was concerned about the smell of the cheese and freshness.  He asked his coworker and he said it was OK. After we got home we noticed that the cheese was rotten.  We are too far away to bring it back and needless to say we will nev

Not what it was. New city hipsters who know very little and care less. The owners (nephews of the originators) seem to be neglecting if not abandoned what DiBruno's stood for. Example: red coloring in the "Chianti" cheese spread.
Check out Claudio's next door for authenticity

Took a chance and did an on line order that qualified for free shipping but I paid the extra $15 for 3 days. Ordered on the 16th of Dec. will not arrive till the 22nd if at all by Christmas. Emailed them about this 18 hours ago with no response yet. I purchased 6 gift boxes at $40 each. Not happy with this purchase so far and I really like their products.

This review is for the smaller Di Bruno Brothers located in the Italian market.

If you're not familiar, Di Bruno Bros has an excellent selection of cheese, cured and dried meats, olives, and specialty Italian goods. They want you to leave happy- the guys here are super friendly, make excellent recommendations and are happy to let you sample cheeses.

If you know the other shop, this is similar but much smaller!

Whether you're having an event catered, making your on cheese board for a gathering, or just shopping the Sunday market... Di Bruno is always A+ service and quality. Some of the packages and catering options can get quite pricey but you're paying for the best!

If you're just grabbing things to take home/host a gathering you can not go wrong with the DB Cheese Spreads -- Abbruzze is the best. (Roasted Garlic and Herb, Smoked Gouda and Beer, and Cheddar & Horseradish also delicious)

The Perfect Pairings Gift is also another good option if you're looking to bring home a little of everything. If your not from the area try to go around the market hours to make it a nice afternoon when you can really talk to the staff about the products and sample a few. 

Catering wise -- these guys are 5/5. Always on time, staff is wonderful and helpful and the food displays/presentation is always gorgeous. And of course, the food is ALWAYS a hit with any type of crowd.

Olives and cheeses and meats, oh my! Di Bruno Brothers is pretty rad on a normal day, but my Love and I got to experience the after-hours magic and boy, were we happy.

For $70 per person, you have the entire store to yourself between the hours of 7:00 PM through 9:00 PM (advance reservations are a must, along with a deposit). There were 10 of us in total and we felt that it was just the right amount of people. The friendly and funny cheese mongers put together numerous plates of cheeses, cured meats, olives, nuts, and even chocolates for us to sample. They explained the rationale behind the pairings as they went along, so essentially, this is not only a food-based event but it's educational also! 

Happen to see a bag of breadsticks on the shelf that you feel compelled to try? Hand it over to the mongers and they'll open it for you. Literally, you can sample anything in the store. And you'll receive a discount on anything you purchase that night also. We purchased some cocoa covered almonds that didn't stand a chance in our home. Fantastic!

The highlight of the event was sampling a very special prosciutto that runs about $100 per pound. Perhaps the pig was a gift from heaven? It must have been, as it was melt-in-your-mouth delish.

The funniest aspect of the evening were the passers-by who tried to enter the store and join the party. Tough noogies! Book your own event and experience the indulgence yourselves :)

Bring your favorite alcohol and bring your favorite foodies. Great night out in South Philadelphia!

What a cool place!

I stopped in here to check this place out and both me and my wife were amazed with all the selection of meats, cheeses, olives, etc. One of the workers there offered to help us and let us sample olive oil and vinegar. We ended up purchasing an awesome tasting olive oil. We definitely were impressed and will be back in the future to buy other things. 
If you are looking for a great place to get real authentic Italian stuff then stop by this place.

Oh my goodness. Food porn galore. Beautiful rounds of exotic cheeses. Phallic-looking big, juicy sausages hanging from the wall.  Varieties of unusual dried pastas, ready to cook.

If you have that look of wild-eyed desire without a clue of where to even start, start up a conversation with one of the friendly guys behind the counter. Next thing you'll know, he'll be offering you slivers of cheeses that will send shivers down your spine. And then he'll recommend some kind of nut you've never heard of that he'll pour into your open palm, waxing poetic about its source. And you'll quietly moan with pleasure.

And then you'll walk out the door having spent money you didn't intend on spending but OH THAT CHEESE.

Di Bruno Bros. is a magical place overflowing with meats and cheeses and filled to the literal rafters with tasty food delights.  These folks know their meats and cheeses and they happily share samples with you.  It is cheese heaven on earth!  I tasted some of the most amazing flavors and textures of cheese and meat that I have eaten in my life.  They were so happy to share details and make suggestions.  The store is an amazing assortment of sights, smells and colors.  There were so many gourmet food items but all I could think of was cheese and charcuterie - yes please!  I will certainly stop by the next time I am in Philly and I am bringing an empty suitcase to fill with goodies.

Loved this place the minute we walked in! Friendly, generous, patient (when you don't exactly know what you want as it is all so overwhelming!). Awesome choices of cheeses, meats, olive oils - everything Italian baby! Glad we were able to experience this location as it is the original on our 1st trip to Philadelphia from Arizona. Nothing like this out west!

Ya'll don't even know. Living in the DC area, any time I would go back to visit my parents in Philly, I'd have to bring home Di Bruno cheese because we don't have it down here. I didn't realize they had a store here (I usually would get it from the Giant supermarket). So I had to stop in. CHEESE AND YUMMY THINGS GALORE!! My favorite is their basic sharp provolone, but really I imagine you can't go wrong with anything from here.

I attended an event after hours at Di Bruno Brothers and it was awesome. There were only about 15 of us and it was just the right amount. Rocco and Dana were in charge our night and they both are amazing! Great personalities, knowledgeable and just cool people to enjoy an evening with. We were able to try tons of cheeses that they would pair as an appetizer or with a jam, etc. They told us what wine or beer goes best with it too while we drank of course. We could purchase whatever we wanted in the store but the Mike's Hot Honey is my favorite. I would definitely do an event like this again there!

Excellent shop for cheese, charcuterie, and everything in between. The guys behind the counter allowed us to sample a few cheeses before making our purchases. We opted for taleggio and pecorino toscano with truffles. Wish I could bring all of it back down to FL!!!

Philly loves Di Brunos!  My favorite location.  Great service, super friendly staff who makes shopping here a fun experience.  Stop in for a sample or two. Incredible flavorful foods! Large variety of cheeses, cured meats, olives & specialty foods.
